sentences.sContent: A superb goal by Owen earned United a dramatic victory yesterday.
sentences.sCn: 昨天欧文的一个超级入球为联队赢得了激动人心的胜利。

sentences.sContent: Some of the most dramatic events in American history happened here.
sentences.sCn: 美国历史上一些最震撼人心的事件发生在这里。

sentences.sContent: the dramatic scenery of the Grand Canyon
...One of the creatures made a dramatic appearance by moving on to the head of the team leader as he slept...
...And this earnings trend is more dramatic among younger people...
...But the more dramatic and meaningful these commitments seem...

synos.tran: 戏剧的；引人注目的；激动人心的

words.tran: 编剧法的，戏剧作法的；演出的
戏剧，戏剧艺术；剧本；戏剧性事件
演剧活动；演剧技术；业余演戏；戏剧性行为
戏剧化；可改编成剧本（等于dramatize）
使戏剧化；编写剧本；改编成戏剧
把…戏剧化；生动地表达（等于dramatize）

trans.tranCn: 引人注目的， 激动人心的； 突然的
